abstract.p: Swiss government authorizes all of the 10 companies seeking to bid for third-generation wireless licenses due to be auctioned on Nov 13 (S)

block.p: The Swiss government has authorized all of the 10 contenders who sought to bid for the third-generation wireless licenses due to be auctioned on Nov. 13. Switzerland anticipates raising as much as $3.5 billion from the sale of the four licenses, the federal communications commission said. Among the bidders are Swisscom A.G., the country's largest phone company, and its smaller rivals, Orange Communications S.A. and a company owned by Diax A.G. and SBC Communications of the United States. A similar wireless license auction in neighboring Germany raised five times the amount expected.

The Swiss government has authorized all of the 10 contenders who sought to bid for the third-generation wireless licenses due to be auctioned on Nov. 13. Among the bidders are Swisscom A.G., the country's largest phone company, and its smaller rivals, Orange Communications S.A. and a company owned by Diax A.G. and SBC Communications of the United States. A similar wireless license auction in neighboring Germany raised five times the amount expected.
